channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Introducing EG-IPT and ipt~: a novel electric guitar dataset and a new Max/MSP object for real-time classification of instrumental playing techniques
item.description: This paper presents two key contributions to the real-time classification of Instrumental Playing Techniques (IPTs) in the context of NIME and human-machine interactive systems: the EG-IPT dataset and the ipt∼ Max/MSP object.

item.title: ConciseHint: Boosting Efficient Reasoning via Continuous Concise Hints during Generation
item.description: In order to fill the blank, we propose a framework dubbed ConciseHint, which continuously encourages the reasoning model to speak concisely by injecting the textual hint (manually designed or trained on the concise data) during the token generation of the reasoning process.

item.title: Multi-modal Anchor Gated Transformer with Knowledge Distillation for Emotion Recognition in Conversation
item.description: Furthermore, we introduce a multi-modal anchor gated transformer to effectively integrate utterance-level representations across modalities.

item.title: Cloud-Aware SAR Fusion for Enhanced Optical Sensing in Space Missions
item.description: Cloud contamination significantly impairs the usability of optical satellite imagery, affecting critical applications such as environmental monitoring, disaster response, and land-use analysis.

item.title: UniFork: Exploring Modality Alignment for Unified Multimodal Understanding and Generation
item.description: Our analysis reveals a crucial observation: understanding tasks benefit from a progressively increasing modality alignment across network depth, which helps build up semantic information for better comprehension; In contrast, generation tasks follow a different trend: modality alignment increases in the early layers but decreases in the deep layers to recover spatial details.

item.title: Acquiring and Accumulating Knowledge from Diverse Datasets for Multi-label Driving Scene Classification
item.description: Of this, KAA accounts for 31. 3% of the gain, and CAL contributes 24. 8%.

item.title: From Data to Knowledge: Evaluating How Efficiently Language Models Learn Facts
item.description: Sample efficiency is a crucial property of language models with practical implications for training efficiency.

item.title: From Generality to Mastery: Composer-Style Symbolic Music Generation via Large-Scale Pre-training
item.description: In this paper, we investigate how general music knowledge learned from a broad corpus can enhance the mastery of specific composer styles, with a focus on piano piece generation.

item.title: MEXA: Towards General Multimodal Reasoning with Dynamic Multi-Expert Aggregation
item.description: Combining pre-trained expert models offers substantial potential for scalable multimodal reasoning, but building a unified framework remains challenging due to the increasing diversity of input modalities and task complexity.

item.title: Instituto de Telecomunicações at IWSLT 2025: Aligning Small-Scale Speech and Language Models for Speech-to-Text Learning
item.description: This paper presents the IT-IST submission to the IWSLT 2025 Shared Task on Instruction Following Speech Processing.

item.title: TeXpert: A Multi-Level Benchmark for Evaluating LaTeX Code Generation by LLMs
item.description: LaTeX's precision and flexibility in typesetting have made it the gold standard for the preparation of scientific documentation.

item.title: Co-Seg++: Mutual Prompt-Guided Collaborative Learning for Versatile Medical Segmentation
item.description: Medical image analysis is critical yet challenged by the need of jointly segmenting organs or tissues, and numerous instances for anatomical structures and tumor microenvironment analysis.

item.title: Machine Mental Imagery: Empower Multimodal Reasoning with Latent Visual Tokens
item.description: Vision-language models (VLMs) excel at multimodal understanding, yet their text-only decoding forces them to verbalize visual reasoning, limiting performance on tasks that demand visual imagination.

item.title: YASMOT: Yet another stereo image multi-object tracker
item.description: There now exists many popular object detectors based on deep learning that can analyze images and extract locations and class labels for occurrences of objects.

item.title: Emergent Temporal Correspondences from Video Diffusion Transformers
item.description: Recent advancements in video diffusion models based on Diffusion Transformers (DiTs) have achieved remarkable success in generating temporally coherent videos.

item.title: A Minimalist Optimizer Design for LLM Pretraining
item.description: For the LLaMA 7B model, SCALE outperforms the state-of-the-art method APOLLO in terms of both perplexity and memory consumption.

item.title: LunarLoc: Segment-Based Global Localization on the Moon
item.description: Global localization is necessary for autonomous operations on the lunar surface where traditional Earth-based navigation infrastructure, such as GPS, is unavailable.

item.title: LLM-Generated Feedback Supports Learning If Learners Choose to Use It
item.description: After adjusting for this effect, two out of seven lessons showed statistically significant learning benefits from LLM feedback with standardized effect sizes of 0. 28 and 0. 33.

item.title: MAWIFlow Benchmark: Realistic Flow-Based Evaluation for Network Intrusion Detection
item.description: This paper introduces MAWIFlow, a flow-based benchmark derived from the MAWILAB v1. 1 dataset, designed to enable realistic and reproducible evaluation of anomaly detection methods.

item.title: Universal Music Representations? Evaluating Foundation Models on World Music Corpora
item.description: Foundation models have revolutionized music information retrieval, but questions remain about their ability to generalize across diverse musical traditions.

item.title: FedFitTech: A Baseline in Federated Learning for Fitness Tracking
item.description: For instance, this system allows wearable devices to optimize the trade-off between capturing common fitness activity patterns and preserving individuals' nuances, thereby enhancing both the scalability and efficiency of privacy-aware fitness tracking applications.

item.title: RAGentA: Multi-Agent Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Attributed Question Answering
item.description: Central to the framework is a hybrid retrieval strategy that combines sparse and dense methods, improving Recall@20 by 12. 5% compared to the best single retrieval model, resulting in more correct and well-supported answers.

item.title: Efficient and faithful reconstruction of dynamical attractors using homogeneous differentiators
item.description: Reconstructing the attractors of complex nonlinear dynamical systems from available measurements is key to analyse and predict their time evolution.

item.title: TransDreamerV3: Implanting Transformer In DreamerV3
item.description: This paper introduces TransDreamerV3, a reinforcement learning model that enhances the DreamerV3 architecture by integrating a transformer encoder.

item.title: Enhancing Step-by-Step and Verifiable Medical Reasoning in MLLMs
item.description: The reasoning performance is determined by an MICS-Score, which assesses the quality of generated reasoning paths.

item.title: Robust Reinforcement Learning for Discrete Compositional Generation via General Soft Operators
item.description: In this work, we show that existing methods, often framed as sampling proportional to a reward function, are inadequate and yield suboptimal candidates, especially in large search spaces.

item.title: Reward-Agnostic Prompt Optimization for Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: We investigate a general approach for improving user prompts in text-to-image (T2I) diffusion models by finding prompts that maximize a reward function specified at test-time.

item.title: Network Sparsity Unlocks the Scaling Potential of Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Effectively scaling up deep reinforcement learning models has proven notoriously difficult due to network pathologies during training, motivating various targeted interventions such as periodic reset and architectural advances such as layer normalization.

item.title: A Neural Operator based Hybrid Microscale Model for Multiscale Simulation of Rate-Dependent Materials
item.description: The behavior of materials is influenced by a wide range of phenomena occurring across various time and length scales.

item.title: Visual-Instructed Degradation Diffusion for All-in-One Image Restoration
item.description: Image restoration tasks like deblurring, denoising, and dehazing usually need distinct models for each degradation type, restricting their generalization in real-world scenarios with mixed or unknown degradations.

item.title: Brain-inspired interpretable reservoir computing with resonant recurrent neural networks
item.description: Compared to existing artificial neural network approaches, the proposed resonant reservoir network (RRN) utilizes oscillatory dynamics expressed as a straightforward extension of traditional artificial neural networks, produces interpretable features for classification, avoids computationally expensive training (e. g., backpropagation), and performs well with few parameters in different classification scenarios.

item.title: Mesh-Informed Neural Operator : A Transformer Generative Approach
item.description: Generative models in function spaces, situated at the intersection of generative modeling and operator learning, are attracting increasing attention due to their immense potential in diverse scientific and engineering applications.

item.title: ParkFormer: A Transformer-Based Parking Policy with Goal Embedding and Pedestrian-Aware Control
item.description: Autonomous parking plays a vital role in intelligent vehicle systems, particularly in constrained urban environments where high-precision control is required.

item.title: Robust Dynamic Material Handling via Adaptive Constrained Evolutionary Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Besides, making the best use of limited computational resources and historical records for training a robust policy is crucial.

item.title: Few-Shot Generalized Category Discovery With Retrieval-Guided Decision Boundary Enhancement
item.description: First, we use a decision boundary pre-training module to mitigate the overfitting of pre-trained information on known category boundaries and improve the learning of these decision boundaries using labeled samples.

item.title: Evaluating the Impact of Model Accuracy for Optimizing Battery Energy Storage Systems
item.description: This study investigates two models of varying complexity for optimizing intraday arbitrage energy trading of a battery energy storage system using a model predictive control approach.

item.title: TextBraTS: Text-Guided Volumetric Brain Tumor Segmentation with Innovative Dataset Development and Fusion Module Exploration
item.description: Deep learning has demonstrated remarkable success in medical image segmentation and computer-aided diagnosis.

item.title: Loupe: A Generalizable and Adaptive Framework for Image Forgery Detection
item.description: The proliferation of generative models has raised serious concerns about visual content forgery.

item.title: Mathematical Proof as a Litmus Test: Revealing Failure Modes of Advanced Large Reasoning Models
item.description: Large reasoning models (e. g., R1, o3) have demonstrated remarkable mathematical problem-solving abilities.

item.title: Noise-Informed Diffusion-Generated Image Detection with Anomaly Attention
item.description: Building upon this insight, we introduce a novel Noise-Aware Self-Attention (NASA) module that focuses on noise regions to capture anomalous patterns.

item.title: Simultaneous Translation with Offline Speech and LLM Models in CUNI Submission to IWSLT 2025
item.description: The backbone of our systems is the offline Whisper speech model, which we use for both translation and transcription in simultaneous mode with the state-of-the-art simultaneous policy AlignAtt.

item.title: Generalizable Agent Modeling for Agent Collaboration-Competition Adaptation with Multi-Retrieval and Dynamic Generation
item.description: Adapting a single agent to a new multi-agent system brings challenges, necessitating adjustments across various tasks, environments, and interactions with unknown teammates and opponents.

item.title: Camera Calibration via Circular Patterns: A Comprehensive Framework with Measurement Uncertainty and Unbiased Projection Model
item.description: The core concept of this approach is to model the boundary points of a two-dimensional shape as a Markov random field, considering its connectivity.

item.title: Generative Modeling of Full-Atom Protein Conformations using Latent Diffusion on Graph Embeddings
item.description: Using D2R-MD, a 2-microsecond MD trajectory (12 000 frames) of the human dopamine D2 receptor in a membrane environment, the sequential and residue-based pooling strategy reproduces the reference ensemble with high structural fidelity (all-atom lDDT of approximately 0. 7; C-alpha-lDDT of approximately 0. 8) and recovers backbone and side-chain dihedral-angle distributions with a Jensen-Shannon divergence of less than 0. 03 compared to the MD data.

item.title: Consistent Sampling and Simulation: Molecular Dynamics with Energy-Based Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion models have recently gained significant attention due to their effectiveness in various scientific domains, including biochemistry.

item.title: RealSR-R1: Reinforcement Learning for Real-World Image Super-Resolution with Vision-Language Chain-of-Thought
item.description: Real-World Image Super-Resolution is one of the most challenging task in image restoration.

item.title: Off-Policy Actor-Critic for Adversarial Observation Robustness: Virtual Alternative Training via Symmetric Policy Evaluation
item.description: Recently, robust reinforcement learning (RL) methods designed to handle adversarial input observations have received significant attention, motivated by RL's inherent vulnerabilities.

item.title: Cache Me If You Can: How Many KVs Do You Need for Effective Long-Context LMs?
item.description: In this paper, we propose the *KV footprint* as a unified metric, which accounts for both the amount of KV entries stored and their lifespan in memory.

item.title: On Training-Test (Mis)alignment in Unsupervised Combinatorial Optimization: Observation, Empirical Exploration, and Analysis
item.description: In unsupervised combinatorial optimization (UCO), during training, one aims to have continuous decisions that are promising in a probabilistic sense for each training instance, which enables end-to-end training on initially discrete and non-differentiable problems.

item.title: Long-term Traffic Simulation with Interleaved Autoregressive Motion and Scenario Generation
item.description: Prior models and benchmarks focus on closed-loop motion simulation for initial agents in a scene.
